item.title: Creative Eye Ltd Q3 FY26: Mounting Losses Signal Deepening Operational Crisis
item.description: Creative Eye Ltd., the Mumbai-based television content producer, reported a staggering quarterly loss of ₹3.68 crores in Q3 FY26, marking a dramatic deterioration from the ₹0.65 crore loss recorded in Q2 FY26. The company, with a diminished market capitalisation of just ₹15.00 crores, continues to struggle with zero revenue generation for the third consecutive quarter, raising serious questions about its operational viability. Shares plummeted 6.42% to ₹7.00 following the results, reflecting investor alarm over the accelerating cash burn and absence of any meaningful business activity. Time: Feb 18 2026 09:16 PM IST

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 4,080 companies reporting results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings has inched up to 46.0%, the data highlights divergent trends across market capitalisation segments and sectors, underscoring the varied pace of recovery and growth in the economy. Time: Feb 18 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Are Evexia Lifecare Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Evexia Lifecare Ltd's latest results show revenue growth of 16.31% year-on-year to ₹25.24 crores, but profitability remains a concern with a net profit of only ₹0.29 crores and declining margins, indicating significant operational challenges and high leverage risks. Time: Feb 18 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Impex Ferro Tech Q3 FY26: Operations Remain Suspended as Losses Mount
item.description: Impex Ferro Tech Ltd., a Kolkata-based manufacturer of manganese-based ferrous alloys, reported continued operational suspension in Q3 FY26, with quarterly losses persisting at ₹1.81 crores. The micro-cap company, with a market capitalisation of just ₹16.00 crores, has generated zero revenue for six consecutive quarters, reflecting prolonged operational challenges. The stock, trading at ₹1.77, has declined 35.16% over the past year, significantly underperforming the Sensex's 10.22% gain during the same period. Time: Feb 18 2026 06:21 PM IST

item.title: Nimbus Projects Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Bearish Outlook
item.description: Nimbus Projects Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Realty sector, has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and long-term weakness in the stock’s price action. Time: Feb 18 2026 06:20 PM IST

item.title: Poonawalla Fincorp Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Poonawalla Fincorp Ltd has recently formed a Golden Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) has crossed above the 200-day moving average. This development suggests a potential bullish breakout and a long-term momentum shift for the Non Banking Financial Company (NBFC), reinforcing the stock’s positive trajectory amid strong fundamentals and improving market sentiment. Time: Feb 18 2026 06:20 PM IST
